commitResults.messageTitle: Implement an initial skeletal version of the Duke that simply greets the user and exits.
Add the ability to store whatever text entered by the user and display them back to the user when requested.
Add the ability to store whatever text entered by the user and display them back to the user when requested.
1. fix bug on Task; 2. add getReport in Task

1. Add the ability to mark tasks as done. Optionally, add the ability to change the status back to not done.;  2.Tweak the code to comply with a given coding standard. From this point onward, ensure any new code added are compliant with the given coding standard.; 3. package the classes
Fix some variable name to meet the code standard

commitResults.messageBody:
1. ToDos: tasks without any date/time attached to it e.g., visit new theme park
2. Deadlines: tasks that need to be done before a specific date/time e.g., submit report by 11/10/2019 5pm
3. Events: tasks that start at a specific time and ends at a specific time e.g., team project meeting on 2/10/2019 2-4pm
Use the input/output redirection technique to semi-automate the testing of Duke.

commitResults.messageTitle: 1. Add DukeException; 2. Add ToDoDukeException; 3. Add UnknownOrderException
commitResults.messageBody:
1. Minimal requirement: todo and unknown order exception
2. DukeException is super class of all exceptions in Duke

commitResults.messageTitle: 1. Add delete function; 2. Add exception for remove and list task

commitResults.messageBody:
1.  Load the data from the hard disk when Duke starts up
2. use relative paths
3. handle the case where the data file doesn't exist at the start.
4. handle the folder-does-not-exist-yet case.
tore deadline dates as a java.time.LocalDate in task objects. Accept dates in a format 2/12/2019 1800, print in a different format 2019-12-02 18:00
Give users a way to find a task by searching for a keyword.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add operation catche in operation factory; apply getOperation instead of makeOperation
commitResults.messageBody: The getOperation will first check whether there are catched operation, if so it will not make duplicate operation, if not, it will call makeOperation.
